result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah Morrell Cockerham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run- Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Reckless Driving (Causing Injury), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
-  Obtain GED/HSD
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Any prescriptions for controlled substances - a copy to be provided to the agent
-  No Contact Order with Balistreri Brothers Pizza, South 108th Street, City of Greenfield
AS TO COUNT ONE ONLY:  Court grants expungement if no new crimes are committed and upon successful completion of the probation sentence.

-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)

Court sets restitution at $0 (zero) as to Kyle J.
Hearing March 24, 2016 as to Balistreri Brothers Pizza.
**3/23/2016 set at zero as to Balistreri Brothers Pizza.

timeConds.notes: Serve 9 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT time, no good time credit to be earned, no electronic monitoring.  Condition time to commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on March 25, 2016.  Defendant to be released from condition time no later than 12:00 p.m. on April 3, 2016.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: the sentence imposed as to Count 1.

Count 1 probation conditions apply.
*4/14/2016  Honorable Mark A. Sanders.  Order signed.  Probation term on count two  commuted to one year.

miscConds.notes: Pay a fine of $300 including costs during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 4/14/2016 (Clerk's entry dated 4/15/2016).

Order Commuting Probation Term on Count two, filed and signed by the Court.  The probation term on count two of this action is commuted to one year.  The judgment of conviction shall be amended accordingly.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify length of probation term on count two.
Associated with Charge #2
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Noah Morrell Cockerham not in court.  Atty. S. McGaver not in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called on the record to address the letter received from counsel on March 22, 2016.  Statements to the Court by the State.
Court finds that the insurance claim has been closed.
Therefore, Court sets Restitution at $0 as to Balistreri Brothers Pizza.
The restitution hearing of March 24, 2016 is vacated from the court's calendar.
Clerk:  jms
from Atty. S. McGaver dated March 22, 2016 received and filed.
Scanned Pictures.vmb
Restitution hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

As to Count 1 only:
Court grants expungement if no new crimes are committed and upon successful completion of the probation sentence.

Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

As to Count 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction. 

As to Count 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction consecutive to the sentence imposed as to Count 1. 

As to both counts:
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  3  years with the following conditions:
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random screens
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Any prescriptions for controlled substances - a copy to be provided to the agent
-  Obtain GED/HSD
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  Perform 156 hours of community service
-  No Contact Order with Balistreri Brothers Pizza, South 108th Street, City of Greenfield
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero) as to Kyle J.
-  Restitution as to Balistreri Bros. Pizza to be determined at a restitution hearing.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)

As to Count 2:  -  Pay a fine of $300 including costs during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

As to Count 1:
-  Serve 9 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT time, no good time credit to be earned, no electronic monitoring.  Condition time to commence no later than 5:00 p.m. on March 25, 2016.  Defendant to be released from condition time no later than 12:00 p.m. on April 3, 2016.

Appeal rights given.  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Court orders case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 28.
State files photos as to sentencing

Defendant Noah Morrell Cockerham in court with Attorney Steven C. Mcgaver.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to amended Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY   and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

State files Amended Information with the court:
Count 1:  Hit And Run - Injury, an unclassified Felony, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 346.67(1), 346.74(5)(b) and 346.74(5)(e)
Count 2:  Reckless Driving (Causing Injury), an unclassified Misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 346.62(3), 346.65(3)

from Atty. S. McGaver dated February 18, 2016 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Sentencing Memorandum, letters and other documents submitted to the court by Atty. S. McGaver - received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Noah Morrell Cockerham in court with Attorney Steven C. Mcgaver.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are requesting adjournment of today's scheduled plea and sentencing.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Noah Morrell Cockerham in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be assigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 Courthouse

Pursuant to correspondence from Attorney McGaver regarding defendant's in-patient treatment, matter rescheduled to December 2, 2015 @ 8:30 a.m. for status.  Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Letter from Attorney Steven McGaver notifying the Court that the defendant will be participating in an inpatient drug and alcohol rehabilitation program in Illinois.  Request made for a 30-45 day adjournment to allow for defendant to complete this treatment.   Email submitted to Attorney McGaver's office suggesting date of  December 1st or December 2nd at 8:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m.

Defendant Noah Morrell Cockerham in court with attorney Steven McGaver.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiting for the accident reconstruction report.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Noah Morrell Cockerham in court with attorney Nicholas Dean Castronovo.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  State is still waiting for medical records from victim.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order for the Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys signed and filed.  Copy sent to Attorney Steven McGaver and State.
Stipulation and Order For Substitution of Attorneys received and filed with court.

Defendant Noah Morrell Cockerham in court with attorney Nicholas Dean Castronovo.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Blood results have not come in yet.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-17-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Noah Morrell Cockerham in court with attorney Jason David Luczak.  Ronald Dague, appearing for Francesco Mineo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms
Defense counsel informs Court that he is now counsel of record.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.J. DOB 6/15/98, Balistreri's Pizza, Robert K.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court orders no driving without a valid license.

Court orders that if DNA has not been taken, the defendant shall provide a sample forthwith in the county jail.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court orders that the defendant is "Advised that he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4)."

Defendant Noah Morrell Cockerham in court with attorney Nicholas Dean Castronovo.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
CASE RECALLED AT 2:57.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
$750 cash bail posted at Greenfield Police Dept.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5-28-2015 at 1:30pm
